headline: Why Zscaler (ZS) Stock Is Nosediving
summary: Shares of cloud security platform Zscaler (NASDAQ:ZS) fell 7.1% in the afternoon session after industry bellwether, Fortinet, reported underwhelming second-quarter earnings. The primary concern for investors stemmed from the revelation that the company is already 40-50% of the way through a major firewall refresh cycle, a faster pace than analysts had anticipated. This news suggests that a significant driver of recent growth may be short-lived, and underlying product revenue growth appears weake

headline: Palo Alto Networks Stock Got Hammered After CyberArk Deal. Earnings Offer a Chance at Redemption.
summary: It’s set to report earnings on Aug. 18.  Everything had been looking great for the cybersecurity company, which was trading near a 52-week high when it announced the  CyberArk  deal on July 30.  Shares of Palo Alto fell 5% the day the deal was announced and kept on falling—they’re now down 15%, to $165.90, as cybersecurity rival  Fortinet  saw its stock tumble after reporting earnings on Thursday.

content.title: Palo Alto Networks Stock Got Hammered After CyberArk Deal. Earnings Offer a Chance at Redemption.
content.summary: It’s set to report earnings on Aug. 18.  Everything had been looking great for the cybersecurity company, which was trading near a 52-week high when it announced the  CyberArk  deal on July 30.  Shares of Palo Alto fell 5% the day the deal was announced and kept on falling—they’re now down 15%, to $165.90, as cybersecurity rival  Fortinet  saw its stock tumble after reporting earnings on Thursday.

headline: Analysts cut Fortinet rating shares as firewall refresh catalyst fizzles out
summary: Investing.com -- Multiple Wall Street analysts downgraded Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) shares following the company’s latest earnings release, which showed that a much-anticipated firewall refresh cycle is already halfway complete, undermining earlier growth expectations.

headline: Fortinet Stock Tumbles 25% After Earnings Beat. Why It Caught a Downgrade.
summary: Fortinet  stock tumbled after the cybersecurity company reported a solid quarter but analysts instead focused on its outlook for firewall-product upgrades.  Fortinet released its numbers after Wednesday’s market close.  “We see a challenging setup going forward as the refresh tailwind diminishes in 2026,” said KeyBanc analysts, led by Eric Heath.

content.title: Fortinet Stock Tumbles 25% After Earnings Beat. Why It Caught a Downgrade.

headline: Duolingo, Fortinet, Celsius: Trending Tickers
summary: Duolingo (DUOL) stock is soaring after the company beat second quarter expectations, raised its full-year forecast. Fortinet (FTNT) stock is under pressure as the company cut its full-year services revenue forecast despite raising billings guidance. Celsius (CELH) stock is jumping after the company's second quarter sales topped forecasts, driven by strong performance from its newly acquired Alani Nu brand. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Duolingo, Fortinet, Celsius: Trending Tickers
content.description:
Duolingo (DUOL) stock is soaring after the company beat second quarter expectations, raised its full-year forecast.

Fortinet (FTNT) stock is under pressure as the company cut its full-year services revenue forecast despite raising billings guidance.

Celsius (CELH) stock is jumping after the company's second quarter sales topped forecasts, driven by strong performance from its newly acquired Alani Nu brand.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Dow, S&P 500 end lower; Eli Lilly shares fall after drug data
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -The Dow and S&P 500 eased on Thursday, as shares of Eli Lilly dropped after data from its oral weight loss drug disappointed, while Nasdaq ended slightly higher.  Eli Lilly, which also raised its full-year profit and sales forecast, fell after the orforglipron drug data.  Investors also digested a Bloomberg report that Fed Governor Christopher Waller was U.S. President Donald Trump's top candidate for the U.S. central bank's chair post.

content.title: Dow, S&P 500 end lower; Eli Lilly shares fall after drug data
content.summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -The Dow and S&P 500 eased on Thursday, as shares of Eli Lilly dropped after data from its oral weight loss drug disappointed, while Nasdaq ended slightly higher.  Eli Lilly, which also raised its full-year profit and sales forecast, fell after the orforglipron drug data.  Investors also digested a Bloomberg report that Fed Governor Christopher Waller was U.S. President Donald Trump's top candidate for the U.S. central bank's chair post.
